metadata.title: CVE-2019-25160 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:netlabel: fix out-of-bounds memory accesses There are two arrayout-of-bounds memory accesses, one in cipso_v4_map_lvl_valid(), the otherin netlbl_bitmap_walk(). Both errors are embarassingly simple, and thefixes are straightforward. As a FYI for anyone backporting this patch tokernels prior to v4.8, you'll want to apply the netlbl_bitmap_walk() patchto cipso_v4_bitmap_walk() as netlbl_bitmap_walk() doesn't exist beforeLinux v4.8.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-25160` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-146.172
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-146.172
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-lowlatency - 4.4.0-146.172
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.15.0-60.67~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.15.0-60.67~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-lowlatency - 4.15.0-60.67~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1094-kvm - 4.4.0-1044.50
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1129-aws - 4.4.0-1081.91
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-1102-aws - 4.15.0-1047.49~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1114-azure - 4.15.0-1056.61
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1099-gcp - 4.15.0-1041.43
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1071-oracle - 4.15.0-1022.25~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-146.172').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-60.67~16.04.1').
linux-kvm package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1044.50').

linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1041.43').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-oracle package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1022.25~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-raspi2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-snapdragon: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
